author: Emma Powell
title: John Legend surprises Londoners with impromptu performance at St Pancras
text:
Wednesday 29 March 2017 11:23 BST Click to followES Entertainment 
John Legend surprised Londoners with an impromptu performance at St Pancras station . 
The US singer, 38, sat down at a piano on the concourse to perform a handful of songs for commuters. 
Legend was swarmed as he sang Ordinary People, All of Me and Surefire. 
The singer received huge cheers from fans who took pictures and filmed the impromptu set on their phones. 
On wrapping up the 10 minute set he was then ushered through the station into a waiting car. 
Legend teased fans ahead of his arrival in the capital and asked his Twitter followers if the piano was still at the station. Surprise: John Legend performed three songs (Lauren Hurley/PA) 
He tweeted: “Arriving at London @StPancrasInt on @EurostarUK. Do they still have that piano there?” Arriving at London @StPancrasInt on @EurostarUK . Do they still have that piano there? — John Legend (@johnlegend) March 29, 2017 
The intimate set was to promote his upcoming world tour which will see him play UK dates in September. 
The performance was uploaded as a live stream to promoter Live Nation's Facebook page where it was viewed by 42,000 users. 
Legend was travelling without his wife Chrissy Teigen, who he was recently holidaying with in Morocco. More about:
